title: T.I.M.E. font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230946im_/http:/typophile.com/files/T_6533.I.M.E._Trust-In-Men-Everywhere.jpg)

Can you help me identify this font? I am a film maker and I would like to use something like this for a credit sequence. I appreciate any suggestions, and names of similar fonts if not the exact one. Thanks ahead of time.

Tarik

 [‹ Fat Bodoni Poster like](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230946/http:/typophile.com/node/42864 "Go to previous forum topic") [PLEASE HELP ME WITH THESE FONTS ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230946/http:/typophile.com/node/42841 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tarik

comments.content: Looks like ITC Serif Gothic with the alternate E.

Hard to tell from that size – even if it has got serifs or not …  
But you could get pretty close with Hypatia Sans, when employing its alternate uncial ‘E’:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230946im_/http:/typophile.com/files/time_4997.png)
Thanks for the suggestions. I have both ITC Serif Gothic and Liberty but I don’t think I have a set with an alternative “E”. Where’s the place to get the alternative “E”?
